intro: Pavia willdenowiana, commonly known as the willdenow's pavia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces showy, pink to red flowers clustered in terminal inflorescences. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and unique foliage. The species is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
